node.title: Modi Relents to Protests as India Moves to Repeal Farm Laws
node.alt: Farmers walking past tents set up in the middle of a major highway as part of a protest last December against the Indian government’s new farm laws.
node.description: The three measures were meant to overhaul the country’s troubled agricultural sector, but they sparked nearly a year of sustained demonstrations.
node.content: ["NEW DELHI \u2014 Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India announced that his government would repeal contentious farm laws aimed at overhauling the country\u2019s struggling agriculture sector, in a surprise concession to yearlong protests by angry farmers. ", "\u201cWe have decided to repeal all three farm laws, and will begin the procedure at the Parliament session that begins this month,\u201d Mr. Modi said in a televised address early on Friday. \u201cI urge the protesting farmers to return home to their families, and let\u2019s start afresh.\u201d", "Mr. Modi\u2019s government had stood firm behind the market-friendly laws it passed last year even as thousands of farmers who protested at the gates of the capital refused any compromise short of repealing the measures. The protesters remained in their tents through last year\u2019s harsh winter, the summer heat and a deadly Covid-19 wave that caused havoc in New Delhi. ", "Mr. Modi\u2019s government argued that the new laws would bring private investment into a sector that more than 60 percent of India\u2019s population still depends on for their livelihood \u2014 but has been lagging in its contribution to India\u2019s economy.", "But the farmers, already struggling under heavy debt loads and bankruptcies, feared that reduced government regulations would leave them at the mercy of corporate giants.", "", ""]
